data.title: 80028F10 Error - Compatibility List For SD TV's
data.meta_description:
ALTHOUGH GREAT CARE AND EFFORT HAS GONE INTO THE LIST.  NEITHER AVFORUMS OR MYSELF WILL BE HELD RESPONSIBLE FOR ANY ERRORS.

IF YOU DO NOTICE SOME ERRORS...
data.text:
ALTHOUGH GREAT CARE AND EFFORT HAS GONE INTO THE LIST. NEITHER AVFORUMS OR MYSELF WILL BE HELD RESPONSIBLE FOR ANY ERRORS.

IF YOU DO NOTICE SOME ERRORS PLEASE PM ME/POST IN THE THREAD AND I WILL AMMEND IT

i would like to start a compatibility list for UK games on a US console. Hopefully we can all add to this list and make it pretty comprehensive. This is only for sd resolutions of 480i/p. the idea is to save me (and other people of course) time/money.

Promos are identical to retail copies. The only reason I have put "promo" is to let everyone know the full story. For the same reason i put (AU) from my copy of Burnout Paradise, because I can only verify what I try, and other people can only verify what they try. Chances are extremely high that if an AU copy works, an EU copy will, and the same thing goes for promo's. They just aren't guaranteed to be the same.

007: Quantum of Solace

50 Cent: Blood on the Sand

Afro samurai

Working:

Not Working (will not work on a NTSC PS3 they will not work on an HDTV either):

Final Fantasy VII

Metal Gear Solid

Resistance Expliot

1. make sure you dont have any resistance patches installed

2. load up resistance

3. get into a level and pause

4. swap the resistance disc with the non-working game

5. wait a bit

6. press the "quit to main menu" or whatever the quit one says

7. cross fingers

8. game should load

would be great if people could add more, if you post below i will keep an eye out and add more to the list. please make sure you try these at sd resolutions.

also, please correct me if something is wrong!anonymous666 has a great thread on this over at the US playstation forum.

anonymous666 has a great thread on this over at the US playstation forum.

6/6/2008 - R:FOM exploit compatibility updated. if it says it has been tested (either by me or a kind member in this thread) it will say if it works or not. if there is no comment, then it has not been tested.

5/7/2008 - R:FOM exploit does work with firmware 2.40

This thread is about NTSC PS3 systems (eg. Japan, US) and PAL software (eg. Europe, Australia) and if they work with a particular game release in standard definition (SD). And yes, even if your UK TV has NTSC capabilities, it will affect you, it is a disc / console issue.

Any games will work in an HD modes (as the PAL and NTSC resolutions match, only the frame rate differs). However, the SD modes of games seem to be encoded on disc in either PAL (576i/p), NTSC (480i/p) or as a multi-format disc, essentially supporting both.

While any game bought anywhere in the world will work on any console in HD, the question we are trying to answer here is: "Will a particular PAL release of a game work on an NTSC PS3 in SD mode?"

Note that this does NOT necessarily have to match the question "Will a game I purchased in the US run on my European / Australian PS3".

As soon as you move up to an HDTV, you will not have to bother about this thread anymore.

I further would assume that if you have an NTSC PS3, you will also need a display that has NTSC playback capabilities... I always make sure mine are (large DVD and LD collection), but maybe there are other threads going into more detail on this.

I hope this helps, let me know if you have further questions. Of course we are always looking forward to more contributions .
